paragraphs.title: Zeppelin Demo Notebook 1
paragraphs.text:
%md
Demonstrate loading, querying, visualizing, and saving a small ~21k row kaggle dataset.
The 'Transactions from a bakery' dataset is documented on [kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/sulmansarwar/transactions-from-a-bakery).

msg.data:
Demonstrate loading, querying, visualizing, and saving a small ~21k row kaggle dataset.
The ‘Transactions from a bakery’ dataset is documented on kaggle.

paragraphs.title: Import Python Packages
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
from pyspark import SparkFiles
from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, StringType, IntegerType

paragraphs.title: Save CSV Data File to S3
paragraphs.text:
%sh
# change me for shell interpreter binding
DATA_BUCKET="gstafford-aws-emr-notebooks"

DATA_FILE="BreadBasket_DMS.csv"

# copy bakery data to/from s3 bucket
if [ -f "$DATA_FILE" ]; then
    echo "$DATA_FILE exist"
else
    wget -nv https://raw.githubusercontent.com/garystafford/pyspark-setup-demo/master/work/$DATA_FILE -O $DATA_FILE
fi

aws s3 cp $DATA_FILE s3://$DATA_BUCKET/data/bakery-csv/$DATA_FILE

msg.data:
BreadBasket_DMS.csv exist
Completed 256.0 KiB/693.9 KiB (5.6 MiB/s) with 1 file(s) remainingCompleted 512.0 KiB/693.9 KiB (10.3 MiB/s) with 1 file(s) remainingCompleted 693.9 KiB/693.9 KiB (4.4 MiB/s) with 1 file(s) remaining upload: ./BreadBasket_DMS.csv to s3://gstafford-aws-emr-notebooks/data/bakery-csv/BreadBasket_DMS.csv

paragraphs.title: Load CSV Data from S3 into DataFrame
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
# change me to same value as shell interpreter binding, for pyspark interpreter binding
DATA_BUCKET="gstafford-aws-emr-notebooks"

DATA_FILE="BreadBasket_DMS.csv"

bakery_schema = StructType([
    StructField("date", StringType(), True),
    StructField("time", StringType(), True),
    StructField("transaction", IntegerType(), True),
    StructField("item", StringType(), True)
])

df_bakery = spark.read \
    .format("csv") \
    .option("header", "true") \
    .load("s3://" + DATA_BUCKET + "/data/bakery-csv/" + DATA_FILE, schema=bakery_schema)

print("DataFrame rows: %d" % df_bakery.count())
print("DataFrame schema: %s" % df_bakery)
df_bakery.show(10, False)

paragraphs.title: Save Data in Parquet-format to S3
Load Parquet-format Data from S3
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
df_bakery = spark.read.parquet("s3://" + DATA_BUCKET + "/data/bakery-parquet")

print("DataFrame rows: %d" % df_bakery.count())

paragraphs.title: Create Temporary View of Data
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
df_bakery.createOrReplaceTempView("bakery")

df_bakeryClean = spark.sql("SELECT transaction, date, item " +
                           "FROM bakery " +
                           "WHERE item NOT LIKE 'NONE'" +
                           "ORDER BY transaction")

print("DataFrame rows: %d" % df_bakeryClean.count())
df_bakeryClean.show(10, False)

paragraphs.title: Replace Temporary View with New Query
paragraphs.text:
%spark.pyspark
df_bakeryClean.createOrReplaceTempView("bakery")

df_bakerySummary = spark.sql("SELECT date, count(*) as item_count " +
                             "FROM bakery " +
                             "WHERE date >= '2017-01-01' " +
                             "GROUP BY date " +
                             "ORDER BY date")

print("DataFrame rows: %d" % df_bakerySummary.count())
df_bakerySummary.show(10, False)

paragraphs.title: Native Zeppelin Visualization Based on SQL Query
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT date, count(*) as item_count
FROM bakery
WHERE date BETWEEN '2017-01-01' AND '2017-03-31'
GROUP BY date
ORDER BY date

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Native Zeppelin Visualization Based on SQL Query
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT count(*) as item_count, item
FROM bakery
GROUP BY item
ORDER BY item_count
DESC LIMIT 10

legend","widget":"option","optionValues":["horizontal","vertical"],"name":"legendLayout"},{"valueType":"string","defaultValue":"","description":"text format of legend (doc)","name":"legendLabelFormat"},{"valueType":"string","defaultValue":"","description":"main title of chart","name":"mainTitle"},{"valueType":"string","defaultValue":"","description":"unit of value","name":"valueUnit"},{"valueType":"string","defaultValue":"outside","description":"display type of data label","widget":"option","optionValues":["outside","inside"],"name":"dataLabelType"},{"valueType":"string","defaultValue":".2f","description":"precision of data label format without : (doc)","name":"dataLabelPrecision"},{"valueType":"string","defaultValue":".2f","description":"precision of tooltip percentage without : (doc)","name":"tooltipPercentPrecision"},{"valueType":"string","defaultValue":".1f","description":"precision of tooltip value without : (doc)","name":"tooltipValuePrecision"},{"valueType":"int","defaultValue":50,"description":"inner size of donut","name":"innerSize"}]}
